page.title: 14SERVICES
page.content: The villages provide quite a wide variety of services between them. Billingborough provides the Fire Service, the Community Policeman,two banks and a mobile bank,a vet who comes to the village hall once a week and a building society. Horbling has a solicitor and a building society. The Fire Brigade is a retained volunteer unit who are called out for the local fires and provide backup for the other Brigades in the event of a large fire. There is no Police station as such in the villages but there is an office attached to the Police house. The mobile library comes to the villages once a week. The ambulance service has to come from Sleaford 10 miles away to take people who do not have their own transport to their hospital appointments.
